Viewing An Article List: Whenever you enter a newsgroup, any articles/messages that have been posted to that group will appear as a list. There a few pieces of information which will always appear within an article list, and those items are described below:

  • "12/05" - Indicates the date that the article was posted.

  • "Fred Smith" - The name of the author that posted this message.

  • "9.1M" - This is the size of a post, measured in either Kb's or Mb's.

  • - This is an Action Icon. Articles in a newsgroup can be text messages, photos, sound files, videos, etc., and if you look to the left of each article you'll find an Action Icon which indicates the type of article you are looking at (paper icon = text message, film canister = photo or graphic, etc.). Besides indicating the type of article or file that has been posted...

    Text message
    Image files: GIF, JPEG, BMP, TIF, etc.
    Exec files: EXE, Zip, UUE, etc.
    Sound files: WAV, MIDI, AU, MP3, etc.
     Video files: AVI, MPG, MOV, etc.

    ...these icons each perform a specific action. Direct Read News will automatically decode and display any file oriented post (MP3, GIF, MPG, EXE, etc.) in the newsgroups just by clicking on the Action Icon that appears next to those articles. As an example, if someone has posted a photo of their car in a picture newsgroup, an Image Action Icon (yellow film canister) will appear next to that article in the newsgroup. If you click on the icon, Direct Read News will then decode and display the photo in your web browser automatically.

    "More video clips from Yosemite - clip1.mpg" is the subject/title of the article, and it's hyperlinked. If you wanted to read the article, you would click on this title link.

  • - This Direct Read News feature assembles and displays multi-part posts as a single file, which can be automatically downloaded or viewed. All assembled multi-part posts will be indicated by one of the "Action Icons" mentioned above, and a green "Assembled" checkmark.

    When viewing headers in a newsgroup, large multi-part posts can needlessly take up space within your viewing area, and will sometimes appear scattered throughout a newsgroup    . Aside from this creating a large list of headers to scan through, it can often make finding specific posts and parts within a newsgroup cumbersome.

    To better organize and display multi-part posts within a newsgroup, the "Assembled" feature will only display the Subject line for the first part of a   multi-part series, rather than display each individual part associated with that post. As an example, if a 5 part file were posted to the newsgroups, all 5 parts would traditionally be displayed in this manner...



    ...but with the "Assemble" feature, Direct Read News will now display the 5 part post as a single assembled file, display an accumulative file size (5 Mb in this example) and a green checkmark will be inserted next to that post in the newsgroup...



    If you wanted to download/view the file, you would click on the green checkmark, and if you wanted to see how many parts were in the post, you would simply click on the post's Subject line (Example: Our summer vacation video - family.mpg (1/5)) and Direct Read News will display the individual components of the multi-part post.
  • - In the event that a multi part post has not yet been processed, it will still be listed with a single Subject line, but a black letter "P" will appear next to the post rather than a green checkmark, indicating that it is "Unassembled".

    If you wanted to see how many parts had already been processed, you could place your mouse cursor over the "Unassembled / P" icon, and a tag will appear indicating the number of parts that were available. As an example, if a 5 part post had been made to a newsgroup, and 3 of those parts were already processed, the tag would look like this...



    In the event that your web browser does not support this "Alt Tag" function, you can click on the Subject line associated with the "Unassembled" post that you were interested in, and DRN will display all the parts that have been processed up to that point.
  • - Often times, you'll run across individual files (images, sounds, etc.), that are all different in their own respect, but they were posted as a series, and as a result all the images relate to a specific topic or subject matter. As an example, if a person posted 5 different photos of their '68 Mustang, the posts would usually appear in a newsgroup like this...



    Some postings series can consist of 50 to 100+ unique files, which inevitably take up a lot of display space when viewing all the postings within a given newsgroup. With that in mind, DRN utilizes a "Collapse" feature that only displays the first post within a long posting series to consolidate and save viewing space within the newsgroups. These types of posts will appear with a "green plus" symbol next to them in a newsgroup, as well as a number (5A for this example) which references the number of individual images within a posting series...



    ...and if you click on the "green plus" symbol, it will display a secondary page that lists all the individual files that were posted within that series. From that page you can then download/preview individual images within the series.
